result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E. Smyth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel E. Smyth

records.addlTxt:
3:08 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Daniel E. Smyth appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Daniel E. Smyth, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard on the status of the case. Def would like to proceed with a plea and sentencing. 
Atty Steiner is heard. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the defendant. Defendant states understanding. Def plead guilty. Court accepts the def's guilty plea and finds the def guilty of disorderly conduct. 

Atty Erickson is ready to move forward with sentencing. 
Atty Steiner is heard on sentence. DA requests 45 days jail, along with costs, if good time is awarded that would be 9 days additional confinement. 
Atty Erickson is heard on sentence. 
Defendant comments. 

Court orders 45 days jail, along with court costs. Def will be entitled to good time, no Huber granted. Court will grant 23 days sentence credit.  
Total of $443.00 court costs, 60DTP

3:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Daniel E. Smyth appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Daniel E. Smyth, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  

Atty Erickson is heard.  Def stands mute and clerk to enter a not guilty plea.
Jury status hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on February 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on February 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:06 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Daniel E Smyth appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

DA requests a $500.00 cash bond.
Prohibit contact with JAS. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Def comments that a no contact order would be difficult financially. DA Suggests defendant engage counsel and go through counsel to make any needed arrangements with JAS. 

Courts orders a $500.00 cash bond.
Prohibit contact with JAS.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Prohibit contact with JAS  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. 
Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
